[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The European Train Control System (ETCS) defines requirements to ensure safe and efficient rail operations under the European Rail Traffic Management System (ERTMS).
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: ETCS manages train control, signaling, and cross-border traffic.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ETCS integrates with onboard balises, GSM-R networks, and traffic management systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ETCS provides interactive consoles for train operators and displays for traffic controllers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: ETCS runs on onboard computers, trackside units, and balises.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ETCS integrates signaling software and GSM-R systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: ETCS uses GSM-R protocols for secure and real-time communication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Optimized for real-time data and secure logs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ETCS ensures 24/7 operation with scheduled maintenance and failover mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ETCS connects to traffic management systems for live monitoring and coordination.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ETCS monitors train signals, enforces speed limits, and calculates movement authority.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for train operators, traffic managers, and railway infrastructure controllers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ETCS relies on stable GSM-R communication, trackside equipment, and ETCS-compliant infrastructure.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: ETCS requires operational GSM-R coverage and adherence to Baseline 3 standards.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: ERTMS: European Rail Traffic Management System
GSM-R: Global System for Mobile Communications Railway

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with GSM-R and onboard balises for communication.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall interface with traffic management systems for real-time data exchange.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall display signal changes and train locations (REQ-DB-002, REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive graphical interface and support multilingual functionality.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process position updates within 2 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 1,500 concurrent monitoring and control users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store train operation logs.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support real-time data retrieval.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow modular architecture.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The software shall comply with ETCS requirements under ERTMS Baseline 3.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with CENELEC EN 50126, EN 50128, and EN 50129 for functional safety and meet railway cybersecurity requirements.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale for high-traffic periods and log critical events for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Ensures signaling accuracy and compliance with ETCS Baseline 3.
[SEC] 5. References: ERTMS Baseline 3, CENELEC EN 50126/28/29, and GSM-R documentation.
